stmt.pretty: lmicl(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, c7, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cfv(c0, c1), c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c3))

body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 →(c0 ` c1)∈ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ c4 =(dist ` c3)
⊣ c5 =(Itv ` c3)
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ TarskiG)
⊣ (w0 → c3[TarskiGDim> =]2)
⊣ c0 =((lInvG ` c3)` c6)
⊣ c7 =(LineG ` c3)
⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ ran(c7))
⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ c2)

|- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(c0, cfv(c0, c1)), c1))

cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 →(c0 `(c0 ` c1))= c1)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ c4 =(dist ` c3)
⊣ c5 =(Itv ` c3)
⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ TarskiG)
⊣ (w0 → c3[TarskiGDim> =]2)
⊣ c0 =((lInvG ` c3)` c6)
⊣ c7 =(LineG ` c3)
⊣ (w0 → c6 ∈ ran(c7))
⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (w0 →(c0 ` c1)=(c0 ` c1))

⊢ (w0 →(c0 `(c0 ` c1))= c1)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c3)
⊣ c4 =(dist ` c3)
⊣ c5 =(Itv ` c3)

comment: Line mirroring is an involution. Theorem 10.5 of [Schwabhauser] p. 89. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 11-Dec-2019.)
